1.title: Meet the New Modern Family
1.plot: A comedy about brothers who don't have much else in this world but each other, Since the death of their mother, they have lived with their Uncle Charlie, who acts as their legal guardian. Although they would love to be typical teenagers, only worried about finishing high school, their Uncle's style of life tests their limits & requires them to not only parent themselves, but also Uncle Charlie. Along the way, they learn the meaning of teamwork, friendship and the struggles of the real world.

2.title: Life as We Know It!
2.plot: Uncle Charlie, Ethan and Evan are moving into another apartment due to Uncle Charlie lack of responsibility to pay the rent on time. Ethan and Evan are left alone to fend for themselves when Uncle Charlie is leaving for his date, an unexpected guest arrives to sabotage his dating life.

3.title: Unexpected the House Guest
3.plot: Uncle Charlie invited his friends James and Avery for their regular Wednesday's game night with the guys. Pete unexpectedly shows up to join the fun. Ethan and Evan was followed by an unwanted guest see how this episode unfolds.

4.title: The Money Maker
4.plot: During an unexpected surprise from Rebecca, Evan initially the idea of working for himself and become an entrepreneur, realizes there is money to be made in selling Uncle Charlie items.

6.title: Vengeful Old Man Jenkins
6.plot: Uncle Charlie is force to buy new belongings when Ethan and Evan sell his items at a yard sale. In an unfortunate car accident Uncle charlie is face with an Unpleasant older gentle, Old Man Jenkins, Old Man Jenkins lure Uncle charlie into an old fashion butt-Kicking in his own boxing ring.

-1.title: The Purge 2: Living with Anarchy
-1.plot: The New Founders of Los Angeles invite you to celebrate your annual right to Purge. The Purge: Parody Anarchy, is not sequel to summer 2013's sleeper hit that opened to No. 1 at the box-office, But a web series called "Living With Uncle Charlie" writer @JoelHarold to craft the next terrifying chapter of Living with Uncle Charlie anarchy.

Since the death of their mother, they have lived with their Uncle Charlie, who acts as their legal guardian. Although they would love to be typical teenagers, only worried about finishing high school, their Uncle's style of life tests their limits and requires them to not only parent themselves, but also Uncle Charlie. Along the way, they learn the meaning of teamwork, friendship and the struggles of the real world.

_Living with Uncle Charlie_ (qv)! Is a half-hour comedy about brothers who don't have much else in this world but each other. Since the death of their mother, they have lived with their Uncle Charlie, who acts as their legal guardian. Although they would love to be typical teenagers, only worried about finishing high school, their Uncle's style of life tests their limits and requires them to not only parent themselves, but also Uncle Charlie. Along the way, they learn the meaning of teamwork, friendship and the struggles of the real world.::Joel harold

_Living with Uncle Charlie_ (qv)! is a comedy about brothers who don't have much else in this world but each other. Since the death of their mother, they have lived with their Uncle Charlie, who acts as their legal guardian. Although they would love to be typical teenagers, only worried about finishing high school, their Uncle's style of life tests their limits & requires them to not only parent themselves, but also Uncle Charlie. Along the way, they learn the meaning of teamwork, friendship and the struggles of the real world.::Unknown

As the premise suggests, _Living with Uncle Charlie_ (qv)!, takes place in an urban neighborhood called Stonebridge. This community consists of a central "neighborhood" made up of a small mom n' pop diner, liquor store, church, High School, a run down public library, and a strip mall. Just beyond the neighborhood lies a Metropolitan city.::unknown
